description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown thin by 20% to One Oak within Area 4 on TPO 7
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The Oak tree situated within the grounds of the ACS International School Hillingdon and borders 10 Sylvana Close. It can be seen from both the school site and over the properties in Sylvana Close as a result it has a high amenity value. It significantly contributes to the arboreal character of Hillingdon Court Park Area of Special Local Character and has the potential for a long life.

The applicant has ticked yes to "Condition of the tree(s) - e.g. it is diseased or you have fears that it might break or fall" however no arboricultural evidence has been provided. Furthermore the applicant is concerned about the tree extending over their garden however a crown thin will not reduce the length of the branches. A crown thin by as much as 20% will introduce multiple wounds through the tree's canopy and could lead to "lion-tailing" and dysfunction.
Having regard to the reasons given for the proposed work, the work is unjustified and will have a detrimental impact on the visual amenity and a
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
